data.title: Free Method to Save YouTube Videos on Innotab 2 & 2s & 3s
data.meta_description: Learn how to download and watch YouTube videos on Innotab 2 & 2s & 3s with this free method.
data.text:
Table of Contents:

Introduction

How to Save YouTube Videos for Play on the Inna Tab 2.1 Open an Internet browser and go to Video Ripper dot me 2.2 Copy the URL of the YouTube video you want to save 2.3 Paste the URL in the Video Ripper site 2.4 Run the Java program and scroll down to find the FLV file 2.5 Download the FLV file 2.6 Download and install Media Coder 2.7 Change the settings in Media Coder 2.8 Add the downloaded file to Media Coder and start the conversion 2.9 Rename and save the converted file 2.10 Copy the file to the Inna Tab and eject the USB drive 2.11 Play the video on the Inna Tab

Conclusion

How to Save YouTube Videos for Play on the Inna Tab

YouTube has become a popular platform for watching videos, and many users want to save their favorite videos for offline viewing. If you own an Inna Tab and want to save YouTube videos on it, you're in luck. In this article, we will guide you through the step-by-step process of saving YouTube videos and playing them on your Inna Tab.

1. Introduction

The Inna Tab, a portable device that offers various features, including video playback, provides a convenient way to enjoy YouTube videos on the go. However, to watch YouTube videos offline on your Inna Tab, you'll need to follow a few simple steps. In the following sections, we will Outline those steps in Detail, making it easy for You to save YouTube videos directly onto your Inna Tab.

2. How to Save YouTube Videos for Play on the Inna Tab

2.1 Open an Internet browser and go to Video Ripper dot me

To begin the process, open your preferred internet browser and navigate to the Website "Video Ripper dot me." This website serves as a tool for extracting videos from various sources, including YouTube.

2.2 Copy the URL of the YouTube video you want to save

Next, visit YouTube and find the video you want to save onto your Inna Tab. Once you have found the desired video, copy its URL by right-clicking on the video and selecting "Copy." This URL will be used to inform the Video Ripper site about the video you want to save.

2.3 Paste the URL in the Video Ripper site

Now, return to the Video Ripper site and paste the copied URL into the specified field. You can either right-click and select "Paste" or press "Ctrl + V" on your keyboard. This step informs the site about the exact location of the YouTube video you wish to save.

2.4 Run the Java program and scroll down to find the FLV file

After pasting the URL, click on the "Rip" button. This action triggers the Video Ripper site's Java program to run. A Java box will pop up, which you need to allow to run. Once running, scroll down the page until you see the available FLV files. The FLV file with the highest quality should be selected for optimal viewing experience.

2.5 Download the FLV file

To download the selected FLV file, click on the provided download link. This will initiate the download process. Depending on the file size and internet connection speed, the download may take some time. Be patient until the download is complete.

2.6 Download and install Media Coder

Next, you'll need to download and install a software called Media Coder, which is used for video conversion. To download Media Coder, visit the official website and choose the compatible edition. Once downloaded, run the installation file and follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation process.

2.7 Change the settings in Media Coder

After installing Media Coder, open the program and navigate to the settings. Firstly, change the working folder to a location where you can easily find it, such as your desktop. Then, go to the video tab and adjust the video bitrate to 600, as specified by VTech's website. Additionally, change the format to H.264 and the x264 setting to baseline. Save these settings.

2.8 Add the downloaded file to Media Coder and start the conversion

Locate the downloaded FLV file on your computer and add it to Media Coder by clicking the "Add" button within the program. Once added, ensure that the saved settings are still intact. Start the conversion process, and Media Coder will convert the FLV file into the desired format.

2.9 Rename and save the converted file

Once the conversion is complete, you can rename the converted file to something recognizable and Memorable. Choose a name that you and your Inna Tab will easily identify. Save the file in a location where it can be easily accessed later.

2.10 Copy the file to the Inna Tab and eject the USB drive

Connect your Inna Tab to your computer using a USB cable. Locate the Inna Tab drive, usually labeled as "G Drive" or similar, and open it. Navigate to the appropriate directory for videos on your Inna Tab and copy the converted file into that directory. Once the file is successfully copied, safely eject the USB drive.

2.11 Play the video on the Inna Tab

Now that the video is saved on your Inna Tab, turn on the device and go to the video section. Locate the saved video and start playing it on your Inna Tab. Enjoy your favorite YouTube videos offline, directly on your Inna Tab.

3. Conclusion

Saving and watching YouTube videos on your Inna Tab is a straightforward process if you follow the steps outlined in this article. By utilizing Video Ripper and Media Coder, you can easily save YouTube videos onto your Inna Tab and enjoy them offline. Follow the instructions provided, and you'll be able to watch your favorite YouTube content anytime, anywhere, without a hassle.

Highlights:

Save YouTube videos for offline playback on the Inna Tab

Use Video Ripper to extract FLV files from YouTube videos

Convert FLV files using Media Coder for compatibility with Inna Tab

Rename and save the converted file in a recognizable manner

Copy the video file onto the Inna Tab and play it offline

FAQ:

Q1. Can I save any YouTube video using this method? A1. Yes, you can save any YouTube video as long as you follow the provided steps and ensure the necessary software and tools are used.

Q2. Do I need an internet connection to watch the saved YouTube videos on my Inna Tab? A2. No, once the YouTube videos are saved onto your Inna Tab, you can watch them offline without the need for an internet connection.

Q3. Why is it necessary to convert the FLV file using Media Coder? A3. The Inna Tab requires videos to be in a specific format for proper playback. Media Coder allows you to convert the FLV file into a compatible format for optimal viewing on the Inna Tab.
